o3-2025-04-16.patternDescription: Every 3√ó3 picture is simply turned 90¬∞ to the left (a quarter-turn counter-clockwise). Nothing else changes ‚Äì the little coloured squares just move to their new spots.
o3-2025-04-16.solvingStrategy:
1. Stop thinking of the picture as emojis for a moment and imagine a tiny 3√ó3 square of coloured tiles.
2. Take the whole square in your hands and spin it one step to the left (¬º of a full turn).  The top now becomes the left side, the right side becomes the top, the bottom becomes the right side, and the left side becomes the bottom.
3. After that single spin, put the square back down ‚Äì that is the required answer.
4. Do this for each training example and you see they all match.  When you do it to the test grid (with the üåç tiles) you get the provided correct answer.
hints: Pretend you are rotating a phone photo ‚Äì tap the rotate-left button once.
Nothing is added or removed; the picture is only moved.
Look at where the long straight line of coloured squares ends up ‚Äì it always shifts from bottom to left, right to top, and so on.
o3-2025-04-16.alienMeaning: The aliens might be playfully showing us that their ‚Äòworld-view‚Äô is literally rotated from ours ‚Äì same pieces, different orientation.  Using ‚ö†Ô∏è, üõ∏, üëΩ, and üåç they could be hinting: ‚ÄúSee things from our angle and everything will line up.‚Äù  It sounds more like an invitation to change perspective than a threat.
